meanings.definition: A kiln used for firing bricks.
meanings.sent1: The brickkiln was hot and smoky as the bricks were baked.
meanings.sent2: The workers loaded the bricks into the brickkiln to be fired.
meanings.sent3: The brickkiln seemed to have a fiery personality, always burning bright.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a brickkiln, constantly firing up to achieve her goals.
meanings.sent5: The brickkiln roared to life, turning clay into sturdy bricks.

meanings.definition: A place where bricks are made.
meanings.sent1: The old brickkiln down the road has been abandoned for years.
meanings.sent2: The brickkiln was bustling with activity as workers molded clay into bricks.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children played hide-and-seek in the empty brickkiln.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a brickkiln of ideas, constantly churning out new concepts.
meanings.sent5: The brickkiln stood tall against the horizon, a symbol of craftsmanship.
